results.title: Great Grand Finals
results.creator_credit: Seven Network Limited (Australia) and Victorian Football League
results.brief_description: Coverage by HSV 7 of the 1983 Grand Final between Essendon and Hawthorn. Also great moments from grand finals of the past: St Kilda’s first premiership 1966, Carlton’s amazing comeback 1970, North Melbourne & Collingwood draw 1977, Carlton & Richmond 1973, Richmond & Geelong 1967 and Nth Melbourne’s first flag in 1975.

results.title: Great gardens of the American west
results.brief_description: There are some wonderful public and private gardens dotting North America’s West Coast and gardening enthusiast Grahame Beakhurst visits some of them, including; a Japanese Tea Garden, Golden Gate Park, San Fransisco Bellevue Botanical Garden, Washington Thompson’s California Heather Garden, Bank of America Roof Garden, San Fransisco Filoli Gardens, Woodside, California, Peter Symcox’s Garden, British Columbia American Ranch Style Garden renovation, Washington Harland Hand’s Garden and El Cerrito, California. Based on the “Discovery” series “Guerilla Gardener”.

results.title: Great expectations [study extract]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Critic and the Film”.
Analyses the opening scene from the Cineguild Production directed by David Lean. Shows how strong dramatic effect is achieved. Indicates in what ways the director’s treatment and editing are contrary to the expected rules.

results.title: Great expectations [BBC]
results.creator_credit: BBC, David Snodin and Julian Jarrold
results.brief_description: A BBC dramatisation of the Classic Dickens mystery story of a young man’s struggle for self-respect. When Pip visits Miss Havisham and Estalla for the first time, his life is changed forever by the appearance of Miss Havisham in the relics of her wedding dress, the room frozen in time from when she was jilted at the alter a year ago. When Pip acquires a mystery benefactor it seems that he now has the required financial credentials to court Estelle, however his wealth is not all it seems. Cast includes Ioan Gruffudd, Justine Waddell, Charlotte Rampling and Bernard Hill.

results.title: Great expectations
results.creator_credit: Cineguild, Independent Producers, Anthony Havelock-Allan and David Lean
results.brief_description: Widely lauded as the best cinematic translation ever achieved of Dickens’ work and one of the greatest British films of all time, ‘Great Expectations’ follows the life of orphan Pip Pirrip from his humble beginnings as a blacksmith’s apprentice in the 1830s to his days as the wealthy beneficiary of an escaped convict he once helped. Despite the inevitable simplifications of the novel Lean fully realises its cinematic potential, capturing the spirit of Dickens and translating his prose into flawless cinema. Cinematographer Guy Green and production designer John Bryan won Academy Awards for their impressive work. Stars John Mills, Valerie Hobson, Finlay Currie, Alec Guinness, Bernard Miles, Francis Sullivan and Jean Simmonds.

results.title: Great expectations
results.creator_credit: BBC, Barry Letts and Julian Amyes
results.brief_description: This excellent BBC adaptation of the Dickens’ novel stunningly captures the power of the original. Pip, played by Gerry Sundquist, grows to maturity thanks to the help of a mysterious benefactor whom he believes to be the vindictive Miss Havisham (Joan Hickson). He falls in love with her cold- hearted niece, Estella, and seems to have successfully discarded his humble past - until the mysterious convict, Magwitch (Stratford Johns), re-enters his life.

results.title: Great English writers
results.brief_description: Consists of three discrete programs, each one of about 14min on three great English writers. The programs are: 1.” The World of William Shakespeare”; 2.”The World of Charles Dickens” and 3. “The World of Geoffrey Chaucer”. Each places the writer and his work into an historical context, utilising location shooting and illustrations from old paintings and lithographs.
